iiv.display

Class DisplayColorMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • iiv.display.DisplayComponent
            • iiv.display.DisplayColorMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ScaleInterface, LocationMapping, NumberFormattable, ShowPointImage, Croppable, FilterSampling, Flippable, Rotatable, Zoomable, CNUFileObject, iiVScriptable, ShowStatus, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class DisplayColorMap
extends DisplayComponent
implements iiVScriptable, ScaleInterface, NumberFormattable
    Component to display a color map as a horizontal or vertical bar.
    Since:
    iiV1.0
    See Also:
    CNUViewer, Container, Serialized Form

      • getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint

        public int[] getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint(java.awt.Point pt)
        Gets the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from based on a point relative to the non-filtered (no flip, rotation, zoom, or offset) image.
        Overrides:
        getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint in class DisplayComponent
        Parameters:
        pt - point location relative to non-filtered image
        Returns:
        indices indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions

      • getNonfilteredPoint

        public java.awt.Point getNonfilteredPoint(int[] indices)
        Gets the point relative to the non-filtered (no flip, rotation, zoom, or offset) image given the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from. This default implementation returns the indices stored in a Point object.
        Overrides:
        getNonfilteredPoint in class DisplayComponent
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        location relative to non-filtered image (negative value for x or y indicates the indice doesn't map to that dimension)

        Determines if the given indices relative to the raw data are located on the display image before cropping.
        Overrides:
        onImage in class DisplayComponent
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        true if indices are located on the image this component represents.
